this game changed my life in the best way possible, i was playing peggle nights and my girlfriend walked in. i thought she would cringe because im bad at the game, it turns out she actually really liked peggle nights and gave me some tips and tricks. for the next couple months we played the duel mode and she always won, about a year after she first saw me playing peggle nights we got married and had two beautiful children, one of them got accepted into harvard and the other became a multi millionare. over all im very glad that i spent five dollars on this life changing game.
BEST PEGGLE 2ND INSTALLMENT WORTH EVERY PENNY

These kinds of games hold a special place in my heart, and I will almost always recommend them. This one too I do recommend, however as with their detective games of this genre the places you look for items looks littered with random stuff. This isn't a problem as much as I've seen similar games place things more natural and elegant without the levels feeling like someone just emptied out their attics. I feel like the adjustable settings are lacking a bit, but overall a very nice but repetitive game 7/10.

While I'm not a fan of hidden object games, I'm going to be objective here - the main reason I do not recommend this one is because of its age.  The low resolution graphics make some objects incredibly difficult to discern while at the same time the aliasing on some objects make them practically glow!  

Stick to more HD and updated hidden object games

A much older Hidden Object + Word Search + Jigsaw + Other Mini-Games Game.

If you are familiar with Mystery P.I. series?  Aka 20 Min Time Limit, Clue Search/Gems + Multiple Locations?  This is it.

It's very relaxing and fans of the Mystery P.I. series (if you actually liked those games) might enjoy it.

Newer H.O.G. players?  Nope!

But if you want to know what it was like for us...  "Old folks"...  Back then?  You are free to take a look.

Even though the company no longer exists...  It's games are still remembered...  :D
It's cute and fun. I used to love eye spy games as a kid, and the books were always a delight. This is hitting the same energy!
